DPRK delegation to visit China
articles.content:
DPRK delegation to visit China
    Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- The DPRK delegation led by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, will pay an official goodwill visit to China from Oct. 15 to 19 at the invitation of the standing committee of the National People's Congress and the State Council of China.

articles.title: S. Korean Internet Journalists' Association formed
articles.content:
S. Korean Internet Journalists' Association formed
    Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- The South Korean Internet Journalists' Association was reportedly inaugurated in Seoul on Sept. 28.
 At the inaugural ceremony Jo Tae Gi, managing editor of the NGO times, was elected chairman of the association and Song Yu Bo, general director of the Citizens' Association for the Democratic Press Movement, its adviser.    
 Personages of different strata in their congratulatory speeches hoped that the association would play a key role as a progressive body opposed to the conservative media and function as a genuine media organization helping the people have the right to know truth and peacefully reunify the country and the nation.

U.S. President's special envoy leaves here
articles.content:
U.S. President's special envoy leaves here
    Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- James Kelly, U.S. President's special envoy who is assistant secretary of state for East Asian and Pacific Affairs, and his suite members left here today.
 They were seen off at the airport by officials concerned.

Message of sympathy to Senegalese President
articles.content:
Message of sympathy to Senegalese President 
    Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of sympathy to Abdoulaye Wade, President of Senegal, as regards the recent sinking of a passenger ship in Senegal that claimed many human lives.
 In the message Kim expressed deep sympathy and consolation to the president and, through him, to the victims and their bereaved families in connection with the accident and hoped that he and the Senegalese government would recover from its consequences and bring their living to normal as early as possible.
